00060 extern pthread_mutex_t  client_list_mutex;

00063 void
00064 http_callback_404(httpd *webserver, request *r)
00065 {
00066         char tmp_url[MAX_BUF],
00067                         *url,
00068                         *mac;
00069         s_config        *config = config_get_config();
00070         t_auth_serv     *auth_server = get_auth_server();
00071 
00072         memset(tmp_url, 0, sizeof(tmp_url));
00073         /* 
00074          * XXX Note the code below assumes that the client's request is a plain
00075          * http request to a standard port. At any rate, this handler is called only
00076          * if the internet/auth server is down so it's not a huge loss, but still.
00077          */
00078         snprintf(tmp_url, (sizeof(tmp_url) - 1), "http://%s%s%s%s",
00079                         r->request.host,
00080                         r->request.path,
00081                         r->request.query[0] ? "?" : "",
00082                         r->request.query);
00083         url = httpdUrlEncode(tmp_url);
00084 
00085         if (!is_online()) {
00086                 /* The internet connection is down at the moment  - apologize and do not redirect anywhere */
00087                 char * buf;
00088                 safe_asprintf(&buf, 
00089                         "<p>We apologize, but it seems that the internet connection that powers this hotspot is temporarily unavailable.</p>"
00090                         "<p>If at all possible, please notify the owners of this hotspot that the internet connection is out of service.</p>"
00091                         "<p>The maintainers of this network are aware of this disruption.  We hope that this situation will be resolved soon.</p>"
00092                         "<p>In a while please <a href='%s'>click here</a> to try your request again.</p>", tmp_url);
00093 
00094                 send_http_page(r, "Uh oh! Internet access unavailable!", buf);
00095                 free(buf);
00096                 debug(LOG_INFO, "Sent %s an apology since I am not online - no point sending them to auth server", r->clientAddr);
00097         }
00098         else if (!is_auth_online()) {
00099                 /* The auth server is down at the moment - apologize and do not redirect anywhere */
00100                 char * buf;
00101                 safe_asprintf(&buf, 
00102                         "<p>We apologize, but it seems that we are currently unable to re-direct you to the login screen.</p>"
00103                         "<p>The maintainers of this network are aware of this disruption.  We hope that this situation will be resolved soon.</p>"
00104                         "<p>In a couple of minutes please <a href='%s'>click here</a> to try your request again.</p>", tmp_url);
00105 
00106                 send_http_page(r, "Uh oh! Login screen unavailable!", buf);
00107                 free(buf);
00108                 debug(LOG_INFO, "Sent %s an apology since auth server not online - no point sending them to auth server", r->clientAddr);
00109         }
00110         else {
00111                 /* Re-direct them to auth server */
00112                 char *urlFragment;
00113 
00114                 if (!(mac = arp_get(r->clientAddr))) {
00115                         /* We could not get their MAC address */
00116                         debug(LOG_INFO, "Failed to retrieve MAC address for ip %s, so not putting in the login request", r->clientAddr);
00117                         safe_asprintf(&urlFragment, "%sstage=prelogin&gw_address=%s&gw_port=%d&gw_id=%s&url=%s",
00118                                 auth_server->authserv_login_script_path_fragment,
00119                                 config->gw_address,
00120                                 config->gw_port, 
00121                                 config->gw_id,
00122                                 url);
00123                 } else {                        
00124                         debug(LOG_INFO, "Got client MAC address for ip %s: %s", r->clientAddr, mac);
00125                         safe_asprintf(&urlFragment, "%sstage=prelogin&gw_address=%s&gw_port=%d&gw_id=%s&mac=%s&url=%s",
00126                                 auth_server->authserv_login_script_path_fragment,
00127                                 config->gw_address,
00128                                 config->gw_port, 
00129                                 config->gw_id,
00130                                 mac,
00131                                 url);
00132                 }
00133 
00134                 debug(LOG_INFO, "Captured %s requesting [%s] and re-directing them to login page", r->clientAddr, url);
00135                 http_send_redirect_to_auth(r, urlFragment, "Redirect to login page");
00136                 free(urlFragment);
00137         }
00138         free(url);
00139 }

00141 void 
00142 http_callback_wifidog(httpd *webserver, request *r)
00143 {
00144         send_http_page(r, "WiFiDog", "Please use the menu to navigate the features of this WiFiDog installation.");
00145 }

00147 void 
00148 http_callback_about(httpd *webserver, request *r)
00149 {
00150         send_http_page(r, "About WiFiDog", "This is WiFiDog version <strong>" VERSION "</strong>");
00151 }

00153 void 
00154 http_callback_status(httpd *webserver, request *r)
00155 {
00156         const s_config *config = config_get_config();
00157         char * status = NULL;
00158         char *buf;
00159 
00160         if (config->httpdusername && 
00161                         (strcmp(config->httpdusername, r->request.authUser) ||
00162                          strcmp(config->httpdpassword, r->request.authPassword))) {
00163                 debug(LOG_INFO, "Status page requested, forcing authentication");
00164                 httpdForceAuthenticate(r, config->httpdrealm);
00165                 return;
00166         }
00167 
00168         status = get_status_text();
00169         safe_asprintf(&buf, "<pre>%s</pre>", status);
00170         send_http_page(r, "WiFiDog Status", buf);
00171         free(buf);
00172         free(status);
00173 }
00178 void http_send_redirect_to_auth(request *r, char *urlFragment, char *text)
00179 {
00180         char *protocol = NULL;
00181         int port = 80;
00182         t_auth_serv     *auth_server = get_auth_server();
00183 
00184         if (auth_server->authserv_use_ssl) {
00185                 protocol = "https";
00186                 port = auth_server->authserv_ssl_port;
00187         } else {
00188                 protocol = "http";
00189                 port = auth_server->authserv_http_port;
00190         }
00191                                         
00192         char *url = NULL;
00193         safe_asprintf(&url, "%s://%s:%d%s%s",
00194                 protocol,
00195                 auth_server->authserv_hostname,
00196                 port,
00197                 auth_server->authserv_path,
00198                 urlFragment
00199         );
00200         http_send_redirect(r, url, text);
00201         free(url);      
00202 }
00203 
00208 void http_send_redirect(request *r, char *url, char *text)
00209 {
00210                 char *message = NULL;
00211                 char *header = NULL;
00212                 char *response = NULL;
00213                                                         /* Re-direct them to auth server */
00214                 debug(LOG_DEBUG, "Redirecting client browser to %s", url);
00215                 safe_asprintf(&header, "Location: %s",
00216                         url
00217                 );
00218                 if(text) {
00219                         safe_asprintf(&response, "307 %s\n",
00220                                 text
00221                         );      
00222                 }
00223                 else {
00224                         safe_asprintf(&response, "307 %s\n",
00225                                 "Redirecting"
00226                         );              
00227                 }       
00228                 httpdSetResponse(r, response);
00229                 httpdAddHeader(r, header);
00230                 free(response);
00231                 free(header);   
00232                 safe_asprintf(&message, "Please <a href='%s'>click here</a>.", url);
00233                 send_http_page(r, text ? text : "Redirection to message", message);
00234                 free(message);
00235 }
00236 
00237 void 
00238 http_callback_auth(httpd *webserver, request *r)
00239 {
00240         t_client        *client;
00241         httpVar * token;
00242         char    *mac;
00243         httpVar *logout = httpdGetVariableByName(r, "logout");
00244         if ((token = httpdGetVariableByName(r, "token"))) {
00245                 /* They supplied variable "token" */
00246                 if (!(mac = arp_get(r->clientAddr))) {
00247                         /* We could not get their MAC address */
00248                         debug(LOG_ERR, "Failed to retrieve MAC address for ip %s", r->clientAddr);
00249                         send_http_page(r, "WiFiDog Error", "Failed to retrieve your MAC address");
00250                 } else {
00251                         /* We have their MAC address */
00252 
00253                         LOCK_CLIENT_LIST();
00254                         
00255                         if ((client = client_list_find(r->clientAddr, mac)) == NULL) {
00256                                 debug(LOG_DEBUG, "New client for %s", r->clientAddr);
00257                                 client_list_append(r->clientAddr, mac, token->value);
00258                         } else if (logout) {
00259                             t_authresponse  authresponse;
00260                             s_config *config = config_get_config();
00261                             unsigned long long incoming = client->counters.incoming;
00262                             unsigned long long outgoing = client->counters.outgoing;
00263                             char *ip = safe_strdup(client->ip);
00264                             char *urlFragment = NULL;
00265                             t_auth_serv *auth_server = get_auth_server();
00266                                                                 
00267                             fw_deny(client->ip, client->mac, client->fw_connection_state);
00268                             client_list_delete(client);
00269                             debug(LOG_DEBUG, "Got logout from %s", client->ip);
00270                             
00271                             /* Advertise the logout if we have an auth server */
00272                             if (config->auth_servers != NULL) {
00273                                         UNLOCK_CLIENT_LIST();
00274                                         auth_server_request(&authresponse, REQUEST_TYPE_LOGOUT, ip, mac, token->value, 
00275                                                                             incoming, outgoing);
00276                                         LOCK_CLIENT_LIST();
00277                                         
00278                                         /* Re-direct them to auth server */
00279                                         debug(LOG_INFO, "Got manual logout from client ip %s, mac %s, token %s"
00280                                         "- redirecting them to logout message", client->ip, client->mac, client->token);
00281                                         safe_asprintf(&urlFragment, "%smessage=%s",
00282                                                 auth_server->authserv_msg_script_path_fragment,
00283                                                 GATEWAY_MESSAGE_ACCOUNT_LOGGED_OUT
00284                                         );
00285                                         http_send_redirect_to_auth(r, urlFragment, "Redirect to logout message");
00286                                         free(urlFragment);
00287                             }
00288                             free(ip);
00289                         } 
00290                         else {
00291                                 debug(LOG_DEBUG, "Client for %s is already in the client list", client->ip);
00292                         }
00293                         UNLOCK_CLIENT_LIST();
00294                         if (!logout) {
00295                                 authenticate_client(r);
00296                         }
00297                         free(mac);
00298                 }
00299         } else {
00300                 /* They did not supply variable "token" */
00301                 send_http_page(r, "WiFiDog error", "Invalid token");
00302         }
00303 }
00304 
00305 void send_http_page(request *r, const char *title, const char* message)
00306 {
00307     s_config    *config = config_get_config();
00308     char *buffer;
00309     struct stat stat_info;
00310     int fd;
00311     ssize_t written;
00312 
00313     fd=open(config->htmlmsgfile, O_RDONLY);
00314     if (fd==-1) {
00315         debug(LOG_CRIT, "Failed to open HTML message file %s: %s", config->htmlmsgfile, strerror(errno));
00316         return;
00317     }
00318 
00319     if (fstat(fd, &stat_info)==-1) {
00320         debug(LOG_CRIT, "Failed to stat HTML message file: %s", strerror(errno));
00321         close(fd);
00322         return;
00323     }
00324 
00325     buffer=(char*)safe_malloc(stat_info.st_size+1);
00326     written=read(fd, buffer, stat_info.st_size);
00327     if (written==-1) {
00328         debug(LOG_CRIT, "Failed to read HTML message file: %s", strerror(errno));
00329         free(buffer);
00330         close(fd);
00331         return;
00332     }
00333     close(fd);
00334 
00335     buffer[written]=0;
00336     httpdAddVariable(r, "title", title);
00337     httpdAddVariable(r, "message", message);
00338     httpdAddVariable(r, "nodeID", config->gw_id);
00339     httpdOutput(r, buffer);
00340     free(buffer);
00341 }
